metadata.title: CVE-2023-32248 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ksmbd, a high-performance in-kernelSMB server. The specific flaw exists within the handling ofSMB2_TREE_CONNECT and SMB2_QUERY_INFO commands. The issue results from thelack of proper validation of a pointer prior to accessing it. An attackercan leverage this vulnerability to create a denial-of-service condition onthe system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32248` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.3.0-7.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.3.0-7.7.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.3.0-7.7.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.3.0-7.7').
linux-aws package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
